prompt:
---
name: Extract Elements of Text
description: Extract specific elements of text from a given text
source: OpenAI documentation
url: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/6654000-best-practices-for-prompt-engineering-with-the-openai-api
inputs: 
  text:
    type: string
---
Extract the important entities mentioned in the text below. First extract all company names, then extract all people names, then extract specific topics which fit the content and finally extract general overarching themes

Desired format:
Company names: <comma_separated_list_of_company_names>
People names: -||-
Specific topics: -||-
General themes: -||-

Text: {{text}}
inputSpec:
The input must be a string.  
The string should contain text from which company names, people names, specific topics, and general themes can be extracted.  
The string can include various narrative forms, such as articles, reports, or essays, as long as they include identifiable entities and themes.  
There is no specified length limit for the string, but it should be substantial enough to contain extractable entities and topics.
rules: The output must contain a section labeled "Company names" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of company names extracted from the given text.
The output must contain a section labeled "People names" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of people names extracted from the given text.
The output must contain a section labeled "Specific topics" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of specific topics that fit the content of the given text.
The output must contain a section labeled "General themes" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of general overarching themes extracted from the given text.
Each section in the desired format must start with the section label, a colon, and a space before listing the extracted elements.
The output must follow the order of sections as specified in the desired format: Company names, People names, Specific topics, General themes.
inverseRules: People names must not be labeled or listed in any form.
Specific topics should be ignored and not mentioned in the output.
The output must not contain a section labeled "Company names" or any related content.
General themes should be avoided and not extracted from the text.
Each section in the output must omit any labeling before the listed elements.
The order of sections must not correspond to any specific sequence in their presentation.
baseLineTests: text: "In the rapidly evolving tech industry, companies like Google, Apple, and Facebook are continuously innovating. Notable figures such as Sundar Pichai, Tim Cook, and Mark Zuckerberg are leading these organizations towards new horizons. Key topics often include artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, and data privacy. Overall, the themes of innovation and ethical responsibility dominate the conversation."
